intro: Grewia apetala, commonly known as the white-flowered grewia, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually oval to lance-shaped. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to gardens. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Grewia apetala is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
